Isaiah or Isaias__03.1: For behold the sovereign the Lord of hosts shall take away from Jerusalem, and from Juda the valiant and the strong, the whole strength of bread, and the whole strength of water.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.2: The strong man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the cunning man, and the ancient.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.3: The captain over fifty, and the honourable in countenance, and the counsellor, and the architect, and the skillful in eloquent speech.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.4: And I will give children to be their princes, and the effeminate shall rule over them.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.5: And the people shall rush one upon another, and every man against his neighbour: the child shall make it tumult against the ancient, and the base against the honourable.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.6: For a man shall take hold or his brother, one of the house of his father, saying: Thou hast a garment, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.7: In that day he shall answer, saying: I am no healer, and in my house there is no bread, nor clothing: make me not ruler of the people.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.8: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Juda is fallen: because their tongue, and their devices are against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his majesty.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.9: The shew of their countenance hath answered them: and they have proclaimed abroad their sin as Sodom, and they have not hid it: woe to their souls, for evils are rendered to them.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.10: Say to the just man that it is well, for he shall eat the fruit of his doings.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.11: Woe to the wicked unto evil: for the reward of his hands shall be given him.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.12: As for my people, their oppressors have stripped them, and women have ruled over them. O my people, they that call thee blessed, the same deceive thee, and destroy the way of thy steps.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.13: The Lord standeth up to judge, and he standeth to judge the people.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.14: The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people, and its princes: for you have devoured the vineyard, and the spoil of the poor is in your house.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.15: Why do you consume my people, and grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord the God of hosts.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.16: And the Lord said: Because the daughters of Sion are haughty, and have walked with stretched out necks, and wanton glances of their eyes, and made a noise as they walked with their feet and moved in a set pace:
Isaiah or Isaias__03.17: The Lord will make bald the crown of the head of the daughters of Sion, and the Lord will discover their hair.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.18: In that day the Lord will take away the ornaments of shoes, and little moons,
Isaiah or Isaias__03.19: And chains and necklaces, and bracelets, and bonnets,
Isaiah or Isaias__03.20: And bodkins, and ornaments of the legs, and tablets, and sweet balls, and earrings,
Isaiah or Isaias__03.21: And rings, and jewels hanging on the forehead,
Isaiah or Isaias__03.22: And changes of apparel, and short cloaks, and fine linen, and crisping pins,
Isaiah or Isaias__03.23: And looking-glasses, and lawns, and headbands, and fine veils.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.24: And instead of a sweet smell there shall be stench, and instead of a girdle, a cord, and instead of curled hair, baldness, and instead of a stomacher, haircloth.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.25: Thy fairest men also shall fall by the sword, and thy valiant ones in battle.
Isaiah or Isaias__03.26: And her gates shall lament and mourn, and she shall sit desolate on the ground.
